(4) All regulations shall be published in the Gazette

specified in the regulations, or, if no date is so speeis;
fied, upon such publication, and shall, as soon ag!

approval. Where any regulation is not approved
either by the Senate or by the House of Representa.
tives, it shall be deemed to be rescinded and the rescis.
sion shall take effect on the date on which the regu.
lation is not approved.
(5) The validity of anything done under a regu-
lation shall not be affected by the subsequent rescis-
sion of the regulation under sub-section (4).
(8) Notification of the date on which the rescission
of a regulation under sub-section (4) takes effect shall
be published in the Gazette.

Taterpretation, 42. In this Act, unless the context otherwise
requires
Board means the Tea Subsidy Advisory Board
established under this Act; i
cuttings ' mean any such cuttings from any!
living portions of any tea plants as may
be capable of being used for propagation;
estate "means any tea estate registered or
deemed to be registered under the Tea
Controt Act, No. 51 of 1957;
Fand " means the Tea Subsidy Fund established
under this Act; ,
. Tea Subsidy Act, No. 18 of 1958 2
green tea leaf "' means the leaf, leaf buds and
immature stalka of the tea plant before
4 they are subjected to any of the processes
(excluding that known as withering) for
:" conversion into made tea;
made tea means tea manufactured from the
Jeaves, leaf buds and immature stalk of the
tea plant;
manufacture", when used with reference to
green tea leaf, means any process by which
such green tea leaf is converted into made
tea;
plant" means tho plant of the species eamellin
sinensis (L) Oo Kuntze, also known as
camellia thea Link and thea sinensis L:
prescribed "? means prescribed by regulation;
proprietor ", when used with referenos to any
estate or small holding, means a person
who has been registered or is deemed to
have been registered as the proprietor of
such estate or small holding under the Tea
Control Act, No. 5% of 1957;
yegulation means a regulation made under
this Act;
rehabilitation ', when used with reference to
any estate or smail holding, means any
operation designed to improve the agricul-
tural conditions of such estate or small
holding and includes the application of
fertilisers, and. adoption of soil gonser-
vatinn measures and Uke planting of addi-
tional tea plants and any other suitable .
plants ia such estate or small holding; +
replanting ", when used with reference to aide
estate or small holding, means the taproof-
ing of alll existing tea plants in the whole
or any part of such estate or sroall holdiagr
and their replacement by new tea plants,
and includes the planting of tea plants in
an area which does not form part of the
estate or small holding, if the tea plants in
an equivalent area of the estate or small
holding are eradicated within such time
as the Tes Controller may specify;
